responses.content: Meta Superintelligence Labs is building next-gen models (Llama 4.1/4.2) with elite research talent, multi-gigawatt clusters (Prometheus, Hyperion, Titan) and self-improving AI to deliver personal super intelligence for billions.

AI recommendation models drove ~5% more conversions on Instagram and 3% on Facebook. Generative creative tools now power a meaningful share of ad revenue, especially for smaller advertisers, while video editing tools and improved recommendations raised time-spent 5-6% across Facebook and Instagram.
Business AI pilots integrate with ads and e-commerce; WhatsApp remains the query leader but Meta AI usage is growing everywhereâ€”AI translation/dubbing and content discovery integrations are coming.

Ray-Ban Meta glasses sales accelerated, Oakley Meta HSTNs (sports-focused) launched, Quest 3S Xbox edition drew record cloud gaming interest, and AI glasses are the main path to embedding super intelligence.

Revenue $47.5B (+22%), operating income $20.4B (43% margin), net income $18.3B, EPS $7.14, CapEx $17.0B, free cash flow $8.5B; share repurchases $9.8B, dividends $1.3B, nonmarketable investments $15.1B, ending cash $47.1B.

3.4B+ DAP, 11% ad impressions growth, 9% price growth, $46.6B ads + $583M other revenue (WhatsApp subscriptions), Europe/ROW lead growth; Advantage+ streamlining global rollout, omnichannel ads, incremental attribution now worldwide.
RL revenue $370M (+5%) thanks to AI glasses as Quest softened, expenses floated near $4.9B with higher R&D; supply ramping to match demand for AI glasses.

Hiring remains focused on AI, infrastructure, monetization; infrastructure ROI strong for ads/ranking but GenAI monetization will lag; exploring data-center financing partnerships to manage multi-gigawatt build.

Q3 revenue guide $47.5-50.5B, FY expenses $114-118B, CapEx $66-72B (narrowed, ~$30B YoY increase), 2026 CapEx/expenses to keep growing with infra and talent, tax rate ~11% with new U.S. law, DMA/LPA updates still unresolved.

questions: What learnings from recent AI progress inform your talent, acquisition, and compute shifts over the next 12-18 months?
What technological constraints are you prioritizing for the next 24 months and what upcoming efforts could lift engagement on the core platforms?
Is your open-source stance different as you push toward superintelligence?
Will Meta continue self-funding its ramp or seek partners to finance the infrastructure build-out?
Is all this capacity for internal use only or could it be monetized externally?
How do you assess ROI as you invest in GenAI relative to proven core AI returns?
What KPIs track your superintelligence progress and how should investors weigh the lag between research and monetization?
Has the cadence of investments shifted relative to core business performance?
How will next-gen models like Behemoth improve Meta AI adoption, especially via WhatsApp, and do you see new monetization opportunities?
Are AI glasses progressing faster than anticipated, and do they replace smartphones or complement the ecosystem?
How are you planning to manage SBC dilution amidst the heavier AI hiring?
